mn120:12.4.pli: Sahasso, bhikkhave, brahmā sahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:12.4.en: Now the Divinity of a thousand meditates focused on pervading a thousandfold galaxy,

mn120:12.7.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, sahasso brahmā sahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:12.7.en: so too the Divinity of a thousand meditates focused on pervading a thousandfold galaxy,

mn120:13-16.9.pli: Pañcasahasso, bhikkhave, brahmā pañcasahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:13-16.9.en: Now the Divinity of five thousand meditates focused on pervading a five-thousandfold galaxy,

mn120:13-16.12.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, pañcasahasso brahmā pañcasahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:13-16.12.en: so too the Divinity of five thousand meditates focused on pervading a five-thousandfold galaxy,

mn120:17.6.pli: Dasasahasso, bhikkhave, brahmā dasasahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:17.6.en: Now the Divinity of ten thousand meditates focused on pervading a ten-thousandfold galaxy,

mn120:17.9.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, dasasahasso brahmā dasasahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:17.9.en: In the same way the Divinity of ten thousand meditates focused on pervading a ten-thousandfold galaxy,

mn120:18.7.pli: Satasahasso, bhikkhave, brahmā satasahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:18.7.en: Now the Divinity of a hundred thousand meditates focused on pervading a hundred-thousandfold galaxy,

mn120:18.10.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, satasahasso brahmā satasahassilokadhātuṁ pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati.
mn120:18.10.en: In the same way the Divinity of a hundred thousand meditates focused on pervading a hundred-thousandfold galaxy,

an3.80:1.3.pli: ‘bhagavato, ānanda, sikhissa abhibhū nāma sāvako brahmaloke ṭhito sahassilokadhātuṁ sarena viññāpesī’ti.
an3.80:1.3.en: ‘Ānanda, the Buddha Sikhī had a disciple called Abhibhū. Standing in the realm of divinity, he could make his voice heard throughout the thousandfold galaxy.’

an3.80:3.5.en: “Ānanda, have you heard of a thousandfold lesser world system, a galaxy?”

an3.80:4.1.pli: “Yāvatā, ānanda, candimasūriyā pariharanti, disā bhanti virocanā, tāva sahassadhā loko.
an3.80:4.1.en: “Ānanda, a galaxy extends a thousand times as far as the moon and sun revolve and the shining ones light up the quarters.

an3.80:4.2.pli: Tasmiṁ sahassadhā loke sahassaṁ candānaṁ, sahassaṁ sūriyānaṁ, sahassaṁ sinerupabbatarājānaṁ, sahassaṁ jambudīpānaṁ, sahassaṁ aparagoyānānaṁ, sahassaṁ uttarakurūnaṁ, sahassaṁ pubbavidehānaṁ, cattāri mahāsamuddasahassāni, cattāri mahārājasahassāni, sahassaṁ cātumahārājikānaṁ, sahassaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ, sahassaṁ yāmānaṁ, sahassaṁ tusitānaṁ, sahassaṁ nimmānaratīnaṁ, sahassaṁ paranimmitavasavattīnaṁ, sahassaṁ brahmalokānaṁ—
an3.80:4.2.en: In that galaxy there are a thousand moons, a thousand suns, a thousand Sinerus king of mountains, a thousand Black Plum Tree Lands, a thousand Western Continents, a thousand Northern Continents, a thousand Eastern Continents, four thousand oceans, four thousand great kings, a thousand realms of the gods of the four great kings, a thousand realms of the gods of the thirty-three, of the gods of Yama, of the joyful gods, of the gods who love to imagine, of the gods who control what is imagined by others, and a thousand realms of divinity.

an3.80:4.3.en: This is called a thousandfold lesser world system, a ‘galaxy’.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.29:2.1.pli: Yāvatā, bhikkhave, candimasūriyā pariharanti disā bhanti virocamānā, tāva sahassadhā loko.
an10.29:2.1.en: A galaxy extends a thousand times as far as the moon and sun revolve and the shining ones light up the quarters.

an10.29:2.2.pli: Tasmiṁ sahassadhā loke sahassaṁ candānaṁ sahassaṁ sūriyānaṁ sahassaṁ sinerupabbatarājānaṁ sahassaṁ jambudīpānaṁ sahassaṁ aparagoyānānaṁ sahassaṁ uttarakurūnaṁ sahassaṁ pubbavidehānaṁ cattāri mahāsamuddasahassāni cattāri mahārājasahassāni sahassaṁ cātumahārājikānaṁ sahassaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ sahassaṁ yāmānaṁ sahassaṁ tusitānaṁ sahassaṁ nimmānaratīnaṁ sahassaṁ paranimmitavasavattīnaṁ sahassaṁ brahmalokānaṁ.
an10.29:2.2.en: In that galaxy there are a thousand moons, a thousand suns, a thousand Sinerus king of mountains, a thousand Black Plum Tree Lands, a thousand Western Continents, a thousand Northern Continents, a thousand Eastern Continents, four thousand oceans, four thousand great kings, a thousand realms of the gods of the four great kings, a thousand realms of the gods of the thirty-three, of the gods of Yama, of the joyful gods, of the gods who love to imagine, of the gods who control what is imagined by others, and a thousand realms of divinity.

an10.29:2.3.pli: Yāvatā, bhikkhave, sahassī lokadhātu, mahābrahmā tattha aggamakkhāyati.
an10.29:2.3.en: As far as the galaxy extends, the Great Divinity is said to be the foremost.

Kosala (1st)

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn32:6.6.pli: “Idhāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhu dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sahassaṁ lokānaṁ voloketi.
mn32:6.6.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, it’s a mendicant who surveys a thousandfold galaxy with clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human,

mn32:13.5.pli: ‘idhāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhu dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sahassaṁ lokānaṁ voloketi.
mn32:13.5.en: ‘It’s a mendicant who surveys the thousandfold galaxy with clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human …

mn32:13.9.pli: Anuruddho hi, sāriputta, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sahassaṁ lokānaṁ voloketī”ti.
mn32:13.9.en: For Anuruddha surveys the thousandfold galaxy with clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human.”

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 32
The Longer Discourse at Gosiṅga

an3.130:1.3.pli: “idhāhaṁ, āvuso sāriputta, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sahassaṁ lokaṁ olokemi.
an3.130:1.3.en: “Here’s the thing, Reverend Sāriputta. With clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human, I survey the thousandfold galaxy.

an3.130:2.2.pli: ‘ahaṁ dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sahassaṁ lokaṁ volokemī’ti, idaṁ te mānasmiṁ.
an3.130:2.2.en: ‘With clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human, I survey the thousandfold galaxy,’ that’s your conceit.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn6.14:5.3.pli: pahomi khvāhaṁ, āvuso, brahmaloke ṭhito sahassilokadhātuṁ sarena viññāpetun’ti.
sn6.14:5.3.en: “Standing in the realm of divinity, I can make my voice heard throughout the thousandfold galaxy.”’

sn6.14:5.5.pli: yaṁ tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, brahmaloke ṭhito sahassilokadhātuṁ sarena viññāpeyyāsī’ti.
sn6.14:5.5.en: Standing in the realm of divinity, make your voice heard throughout the thousandfold galaxy.’

About Aruṇavatī

mn123:7.6.pli: Ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvan’ti.
mn123:7.6.en: And this ten-thousandfold galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.’

mn123:21.5.pli: Ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati, appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvan’ti.
mn123:21.5.en: And this ten-thousandfold galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.’

dn14:1.17.7.pli: Ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati. Appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
dn14:1.17.7.en: And this ten-thousandfold galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.

dn14:1.30.4.pli: Ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
dn14:1.30.4.en: And this ten-thousandfold galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.

sn47.28:2.7.pli: Imesañca panāhaṁ, āvuso, catunnaṁ satipaṭṭhānānaṁ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā sahassaṁ lokaṁ abhijānāmī”ti.
sn47.28:2.7.en: And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly know the thousandfold galaxy.”

an3.125:3.3.en: And while this discourse was being spoken, the thousandfold galaxy shook.

sn56.11:13.2.pli: Ayañca dasasahassilokadhātu saṅkampi sampakampi sampavedhi, appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pāturahosi atikkamma devānaṁ devānubhāvanti.
sn56.11:13.2.en: And this ten-thousandfold galaxy shook and rocked and trembled. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appeared in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.
